newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks end weaker, but avoid Dow losses.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks end weaker, but avoid Dow losses.

text.p: CHANGE CHANGE
FTSE100 4292.30 +23.00 GOLD (NY-COMEX) US$N/A
NIKKEI 17703.37 -318.33 LME CASH NICKEL US$7295 +85.0
CANDLR 1.3892 LME CASH ALUM US$1550.0 +4.0
CAN 30-YR 107.58 +0.04 BRENT CRUDE US$17.73 -0.18
* Toronto stocks ended weaker on Wednesday, but avoided Wall Street's steeper decline * Equities hit by profit-taking and jitters over interest rates * 97 million shares traded
Toronto stocks ended weaker on Wednesday as jitters about interest rates and upcoming first-quarter profits weighed on Canada's largest equity market.
The TSE 300 Composite Index fell 22.30 points to close at 5798.71 in hefty turnover of 97.5 million shares worth C$1.38 billion.

Declining stocks outpaced advances 575 to 365, with 272 issues unchanged. "We're in a choppy market and there is still a little bit of nervousness about what the U.S. Federal Reserve will do next May," said Fred Ketchen, director of equity trading for ScotiaMcLeod Inc.
The U.S. Federal Reserve's rate-setting policy committee is scheduled to hold a key meeting on May 22, when some economists expect a further hike in U.S. rates.
Ketchen said some investors were also wary ahead of the first-quarter earnings season that kicks off this week.
Shares in Alcan Aluminium Ltd were down sharply on Wednesday ahead of its first-quarter results expected on Thursday.
"They are not going to measure up, many people say, to the US$0.53 a share they earned in the first quarter of 1995," Ketchen said.
Lower commodity prices are expected to hurt Canadian resource companies in the first quarter, but other sectors such as banking and industrials were seen having a good quarter.
--- HOT STOCKS ---
* Alcan fell 1.05 to close at 43.35 on 1.5 million shares. Among other base metal stocks, Inco dropped 0.70 to 42.55.
* Bre-X Minerals eased 0.02 to close at 2.27 on 15.9 million shares as rumors continued to swirl around its controversial Busang gold discovery.
* Canadian Occidental Petroleum jumped 1.65 to 26.75 after winning a takeover battle for Wascana Energy Inc.
((Reuters Toronto Bureau (416) 941-8100))
